content.description: Use the same start as Dicentra, but once you pull your feet up, campus to the huge pocket. Find your feet, hit the lip, and top out. Super fun!
content.protection: Couple pads and a spotter for the small tree
content.location: It ascends the left side of the overhang. There are good crimp holds to start on.

content.description: Move up on the far right of the slab using the arete. This is good for warming up.

The crux section is at the very beginning. Start matched in the U/smile shaped pocket. Work up through some crimps. Gain the big jug at the crack. After gaining the jug, work your way up the crack to the top right of the boulder. Top out at the peak.
content.protection: A couple of pads, the more the merrier. A spotter once you’re over the lip is nice.
content.location: This is on the overhung portion of the boulder.

content.description: Start sitting around the corner on the left side with a pinch and crimp. Traverse right along the lip to eventually meet the hueco, and top out. This has superb movement.
content.location: It is on the left side of Trillium Boulder.

content.description:
Sit start with two hands on the big under-cling rail. The adjacent boulder is on, for feet. See beta image for the line and also to learn about the correct hold to throw to. Top-out after the sharp throw! 

  If you don't hit the jug marked with the purple "X" (found on the Beta image), then that makes it a bit easier.
content.location: It is in between Trillium and ??.

content.description:
Sit start right side arete by a dead tree. Follow the arete to the peak. 

  Descend the short, arete climb with a pit/cave for a landing.
content.protection: Two pads or more. For having a pit for a landing, it’s really not too bad.
content.location: It is on the back side of the boulder opposite of Trillium, etc.

content.description: Lemon Squeezy is the slab problem to the right of "Easy Peasy". The arete is off. This is the hardest slab line on the boulder. There is one lemon-sized bulge to use. All other points of contact are fairly small, partially due to how dirty the slab still is.
content.location: It is to the right of "Easy Peasy". See the route image of the general the line.

content.description: Stand start with hands on holds marked in beta photo. Work your way up tiny crimps, and top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter for the topout.
content.location: It is in between Trillium and ?Babe the Blue Ox?.

content.description: Fire is a powerful, crimpy problem with excellent movement. The detached pedestal is OFF.
content.location: Sit start in a bad crimp slot. Match the slot, and get a right foot into first crimp you hit on Trillium. Then fire away. Use the obvious flake system to gain a jug. Pedestal is off for feet.

content.description: This is a fun, easy, slab problem on the Trillium Boulder. See the image for the route. This is the easiest slab problem here. Start with feet as low as possible on that rail (underneath slab portion of bolder). Work your way up using larger bulges on the slab.
content.location: This is on the slab side of Trillium Boulder (see the image).

content.description: The opening campus moves are from a left hand crimp and a right hand at the beginning of the horizontal crack. Campus through the crack right until you can get feet. Move up for the same top out as Trillium.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: This is to the left of Trillium. There may be an extension to this problem. I am still working on that project.

content.description: Start on the same holds for Babe the Blue Ox . Instead of rolling the arete, head straight up the face finishing up as you would on Hard Scrabble.  Originally done from a set of holds higher and used the arete. Resent from lower holds and eliminated the arete.
content.protection: A couple pads. A spotter would be nice.

content.description: Sit start with left hand in Trillium smile shaped pocket and right hand somewhere under the overhang. Work through the overhang and roll arete using a hidden low hold around the arete.

This is a nice quality boulder with a high concentration of problems. There’s an overhung portion, a crack, a slopey arete over a pit, and super slabby side.  Slab side has boulders stacked upon boulders. Watch your footing. Some holes are obscured with sticks and leaves. The overhung portion has a wonderful flat landing which is a rare treat around here. Get off boulder on the back left side. Crab walk down ramp to some dead trees.
